import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem continuousWithinAt_Icc_iff_seq_tendsto
    {f : â„ â†’ â„} {a b xâ‚€ : â„} (hxâ‚€ : xâ‚€ âˆˆ Set.Icc a b) :
  ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Icc a b) xâ‚€ â†”
  âˆ€ (x : â„• â†’ â„), (âˆ€ n, x n âˆˆ Set.Icc a b) â†’ Tendsto x atTop (ğ“ xâ‚€) â†’

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ f is a function defined on a closed interval $[a,b]$ and $\overline{x} \in [a,b]$ [tc_1]
â€¢ f is continuous at $\overline{x}$ [def_1]
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $x \in [a,b]$, if $|x - \overline{x}| < \delta$, then $|f(x) - f(\overline{x})| < \epsilon$ [l1].

Therefore, we conclude:

By contraposition, if for every sequence $\{x_n\}$ converging to $\overline{x}$, $\{f(x_n)\}$ converges to $f(\overline{x})$, then $f$ must be continuous at $\overline{x}$. [ts_2].
